intro: Cyrtandra ammitophila, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streamside areas. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cyrtandra ammitophila is considered a rare and endangered species.
